chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th w/in 5 yrs)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Chough was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Chough is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Chough was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Michael Chough was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs paid from bond posted.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

timeConds.notes:
10/10/2016 - If accepted, defendant may serve his jail sentence on Ct. 1 & 4 in Milwaukee County.

1/27/2017 - Court grants defendant furlough on jail term on Ct. 1/Ct. 4 for defendant to travel out of state for a business trip. Furlough granted from  2/19/2017 at 6:00 am to 2/24/2017 at 8:00 pm. During the furlough defendant must maintain absolute sobriety including no controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by a physician and in conformity with said prescription.
Consecutive to: Ct. 4

miscConds.notes: Fine paid in full from bond posted.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

-AODA and any counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
-Absolute sobriety.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-Random tests.
-Submit DNA sample.
-Pay supervision fees.

*Credit for -1- day, if revoked.

Defendant Michael Chough in court, in custody.  Patti L Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant did not request the public defender services for the bail hearing today. Court finds good cause for extending time limits.
